glsa.title: JRuby: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A hash collision vulnerability in JRuby allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: JRuby is a Java-based Ruby interpreter implementation.

description.p: JRuby does not properly randomize hash functions to protect against hash collision attacks.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted input, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All JRuby users should upgrade to the latest version:
